abstract: The base annotation object for creating custom annotations.

rawMarkdown:
---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/MapKitJS/Annotation
crawled: 2025-12-05T12:21:57Z
---

# Annotation

**Class**

The base annotation object for creating custom annotations.

## Declaration

```swift
class Annotation extends MapKitEventTarget
```

## Overview

An annotation represents data that you want to display on the map’s surface. Associate each annotation with a [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Annotation/coordinate] on the map. Use the extended objects [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/MarkerAnnotation] and [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/ImageAnnotation] to create annotations on the map, or `/Annotation` to customize a view beyond the presentation that [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/ImageAnnotation] or [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/MarkerAnnotation] provide.

The examples below create a custom annotation using a person’s initials to show them on the map. The following CSS style encloses the initials in a gray circle:

```javascript
.circle-annotation {
    width: 32px;
    height: 32px;
    border-radius: 50%;
    color: #FFF;
    background-color: #CCC;
    text-align: center;
    line-height: 32px;
}
```

The following code creates the annotation:

```javascript
const people = [
    { title: "Juan Chavez",
      coordinate: new mapkit.Coordinate(37.3349, -122.0090201),
      role: "developer",
      building: "HQ" },
    { title: "Anne Johnson",
      coordinate: new mapkit.Coordinate(37.722319, -122.434979),
      role: "manager",
      building: "HQ" }
];

const factory = function(coordinate, options) {
    const div = document.createElement("div"),
        name = options.title,           // "Juan Chavez"
        parts = name.split(' ');        // ["Chavez", "Juan"]
    div.textContent = parts[0].charAt(0) + parts[1].charAt(0);    // "JA"
    div.className = "circle-annotation";
    return div;
};

people.forEach(function(person) {
    const options = {
        title: person.title,
        data: { role: person.role, building: person.building }
    };
    const annotation = new mapkit.Annotation(person.coordinate, factory, options);
    map.addAnnotation(annotation);
});
```

## Creating an annotation

- **new Annotation(location, factory, options)**: Creates a new annotation given its location and initialization options.
- **AnnotationConstructorOptions**: An object that contains options for creating annotation features.

## Getting the map and element

- **map**: The map that the framework adds the annotation to.
- **element**: The annotation’s element in the DOM.

## Getting the Place ID

- **id**: The place ID that references a place or a map feature.

## Getting and setting data, titles, and the accessibility label

- **data**: Data that you define that’s specific to an annotation.
- **title**: The text to display in the annotation’s callout.
- **subtitle**: The text to display as a subtitle on the second line of an annotation’s callout.
- **accessibilityLabel**: Accessibility text for the annotation.

## Getting and setting annotation appearance

- **coordinate**: The annotation’s coordinate.
- **anchorOffset**: An offset that changes the annotation’s default anchor point.
- **appearanceAnimation**: A CSS animation that runs when the annotation appears on the map.
- **displayPriority**: A numeric hint that the map uses to prioritize how it displays annotations.
- **padding**: Spacing to add around the annotation when showing items.
- **size**: The desired dimensions of the annotation, in CSS pixels.
- **visible**: A Boolean value that determines whether the annotation is visible or hidden.

## Getting and setting interaction behavior

- **animates**: A Boolean value that determines whether the framework animates the annotation.
- **draggable**: A Boolean value that determines whether the user can drag the annotation.
- **selected**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the map shows the annotation in a selected state.
- **enabled**: A Boolean value that determines whether the annotation responds to user interaction.

## Managing callouts

- **callout**: A delegate that enables you to customize the annotation’s callout.
- **calloutEnabled**: A Boolean value that determines whether the map shows an annotation’s callout.
- **calloutOffset**: An offset that changes the annotation callout’s default placement.

## Managing clustering

- **memberAnnotations**: An array of annotations that the framework groups together in a cluster.
- **clusteringIdentifier**: An identifier for grouping annotations into the same cluster.
- **collisionMode**: A mode that determines the shape of the collision frame.

## Managing selection accessories

- **selectionAccessory**: An accessory that displays place information when a person selects a place.
- **selectionAccessoryOffset**: An offset that changes the selection accessory’s default anchor point.

## Static properties

- **DisplayPriority**: A static property that allows you to access the available display priority enumeration values.
- **CollisionMode**: A static property that allows you to access the annotation’s collision mode enumeration values.

## Annotations

- **Clustering annotations**: Combine multiple annotations into a single clustered annotation.
- **ImageAnnotation**: A customized annotation with image resources that you provide.
- **MarkerAnnotation**: An annotation that displays a balloon-shaped marker at the designated location.
- **PlaceAnnotation**: An annotation for a place.
- **MapFeatureAnnotation**: An object that represents a map feature that the user selects.
- **UserLocationAnnotation**: An annotation that represents someone’s location.

## Inherits From

- MapKitEventTarget

## Inherited By

- ImageAnnotation
- MarkerAnnotation
- UserLocationAnnotation
